Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Friday September 12), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for friday, september 12th. google's parent company, alphabet, announced it plans to invest $1 billion into expanding its data center operations across europe. this move is part of a larger strategy to enhance google's cloud capabilities and meet the growing demand for data storage in the digital age. alphabet is focusing on green energy by ensuring that all data centers are run using renewable power sources.

in other news, meta ceo mark zuckerberg unveiled the company's latest virtual reality headset, the oculus quest pro, during the annual connect conference. the new headset offers an enhanced user experience with improved graphics, longer battery life, and a suite of new apps designed to integrate seamlessly with meta's vr social platform, horizon worlds. this product launch is seen as a pivotal step in meta's efforts to dominate the evolving metaverse landscape.

shares of intel rose today following reports that the company is in talks to supply chips for tesla's full self-driving technology. the potential deal could significantly bolster intel’s position in the automotive sector, as it looks to capitalize on the growing demand for autonomous vehicle technology. analysts are optimistic about the partnership, seeing it as a strategic win for both companies.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for friday, september 12th.

alphabet, google's parent company, announced a major initiative to expand its data center operations across europe with a $1 billion investment. this move aims to bolster google's cloud capabilities and address the surging demand for data storage in today's digital era. in line with its commitment to sustainability, alphabet is ensuring all data centers are powered by renewable energy sources.

shifting gears to meta, ceo mark zuckerberg took the stage at the annual connect conference to unveil the oculus quest pro, the company's newest virtual reality headset. the updated device promises an enhanced user experience with superior graphics, extended battery life, and a range of new applications designed to integrate seamlessly with horizon worlds, meta's vr social platform. this product launch marks a significant stride in meta's ambition to lead in the burgeoning metaverse space.

in the chip sector, intel saw its shares rise today amid reports it's in discussions to supply chips for tesla's full self-driving technology. should this deal materialize, it could significantly strengthen intel's foothold in the automotive industry as it seeks to tap into the increasing demand for autonomous vehicle technology. analysts view this potential partnership as a strategic boost for both companies.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-365 Alphabet's $1b Data Center Expansion in Europe 💹, Meta's Oculus Quest Pro Unveiled 🕶️, Intel's Potential Tesla Chip Deal 🚗
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for friday, september 12th! explore the latest developments:

  • alphabet's european expansion: google's parent company invests $1 billion to enhance data center operations across europe, boosting cloud capabilities and sustainability with renewable energy-powered facilities.
  • meta's oculus quest pro launch: at the annual connect conference, ceo mark zuckerberg unveils the new vr headset featuring improved graphics, extended battery life, and new applications, bolstering meta's metaverse ambitions.
  • intel-tesla chip partnership: intel shares rise upon reports of potential collaboration to supply chips for tesla's full self-driving technology, promising a stronger foothold in the autonomous vehicle market.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image capturing a futuristic, high-tech landscape. in the foreground, a massive, modern data center with sleek architecture is nestled in a lush european countryside, its glass walls reflecting the verdant surroundings and the advanced technology within, symbolizing alphabet's data center expansion. across the sky, a dynamic virtual reality scene unfolds with a stylized, translucent oculus quest pro headset projecting immersive holograms, showcasing augmented landscapes and digital worlds blending seamlessly with reality. in the background, a streamlined electric car resembling a tesla navigates through a smart city grid, its path illuminated by glowing circuit patterns on the road, representing intel's potential chip deal. the image harmoniously integrates these elements, using a cool color palette dominated by blues and greens, with touches of vibrant neon accents to evoke innovation and interconnectivity in the tech landscape
